caption: Hidden in the shadow of the Pompidou, Atelier Brancusi is an unassuming gem in the centre of the city. Small but perfectly curated, it's an inspiring place with lots of sculptural works in different materials. Slightly 'off the beaten track' of art institutions in Paris, it's a must see for design lovers.

A very lovely corner for those who love sculpture and the relationship between art and space. Constantin Br√¢ncu»ôi was a Romanian sculptor who was trained at Bucharest school of fine arts. He did some amazing work and there are many pieces you can admire in Paris. This is not the original studio but a remake by the architect Renzo Piano who did an amazing job capturing the essence of a private cozy space where Br√¢ncu»ôi created such amazing art. The lighting is lovely and so soft, giving the impression of smoothness to the rough edges and is very similar to the original studio. You can also admire his original tools and photos of his old studios. I cannot recommend this enough, it's is a very special space, a hidden gem in the middle of Paris.

A free museum! And for the better, as it only has a big centered exposition of all of Br√¢ncu≈üi's artwork. There's a historic of how he came to Paris and the struggles he had to suffer through before he was able to afford his own workshops.  The information is in both french and english, but it was presented very theoretical. Didn't feel like a story was being told. There was not much focus on the great sculptures inside, and there was no mention of anything he did in Romania, prior to coming to Paris.  This isn't his actual workshop, and it discloses it early on. The artwork used to be in open air.  It's a trip worth taking, considering it's free.
One of my favorite sculptures. Incredibly addicted to his work. Do not miss it on your trip to Paris. Biggg recommend üëå ‚Ä¶

Masterpiece of art. A little jewellery in the middle of Paris. For me, Br√¢ncu»ôi is the biggest stone-carver. He realize to express the spiritual ideas and feelings in a material way. A Romanian who honours his country in all the world. His works deserves a biggest museum, each of them needing a large space around to be appreciated at it's real value.

I went to Atelier Br√¢ncu≈üi by accident, me and my friends, we just walk through the metro!  This place is full of design thing... I love the construction of this building and take time for shot many photos here! Hope I could be back, I will sightseeing inside Atelier Br√¢ncu≈üi for sure!

L' Atelier Brancusi is a free attraction next to Centre Pompidou and a very good side attraction for anyone with an interest in Brancusi or art/sculptures in general. Opening hours are 2-6pm daily (closed Tuesdays).  Here you find a recreation of Roman sculptor Constantin Brancusi's studio and workshop upon the time of his death in 1957. There are numerous sculptures on display including several renditions of his famous 'Bird In Space' sculpture, amongst numerous other provocative an intriguing works to view and enjoy.  There was also an interesting Mihal Olos exhibition being held at the time of our visit. We enjoyed the artworks being displayed, finding them to complement the Brancusi works nicely.  We were quite pleased with our return visit to L' Atelier Brancusi. This is a very good complement to visits to Centre Pompidou, especially with the attraction being free to visit.
This exhibition of Brancusi‚Äôs atelier gives you insight into his living and creation spaces, which always fascinated me. An item to put on the Paris itinerary.
I admire this sculptor üòç The gallery is small and free.  A lot of works have been collected. ‚Ä¶
Definietly worth visiting, it's a small but interesting exhibition for free. In the studio we can see his sculptures, workplace, all the different tools, the cameras and even his guitar.

This is a "museum" that respects entirely Brancusi's old workshop and you can see almost all his art pieces. Moreover, it helps you understand his life and, in fact, what was going through his mind. However, I had an unpleasant visit there. The staff was rude and impolite with my group and what is more, even though the museum closes at 6 PM, we were forced to leave twenty minutes before. Thus, we did not manage to fully enjoy our visit there.
You say visiting Paris is costly? You might be surprised, there are some places you can see for absolutely free. One of them is the workshop of sculptor Brancusi located in Pompidou centre.
A free museum and art exhibition of the Romanian artist Brancusi. I think it is the only one and it is outside of the center of Pompidou.
A true inspiration! The studio is very aquarate reproduced. You can see the tools and the art pieces in different stages of work.

Hidden gem next to Centre Pompidou. The workshop of the Romanian sculptor Constantin Br√¢ncu»ôi contains a part of his artworks, in his workshop layout setting.  It was great to see the masterpieces in the studio setting, in their original layout.  Place is not crowded, there are only few rooms, but definitely worth visiting. Free entrance, but even if it was paid for, it would still deserve it.
This is very close to Centre Pompidou and the entrance is free! Don‚Äôt miss the chance to visit it, if you‚Äôre in the area!
It's a masterpiece and worth seeing witj your own eyes. The opening times are from 2pm until 6 pm so plan for the afternoon
Amazing artist Brancus.... and to have the chance to see the tools used to create his gifts to the world is priceless. Good position, close to the Pompidou, Notre-Dame, and Louvre.
The place where I was crying, the place where your spirit goes to another dimension and tries to connect with the energy of one of the greatest artists of the 20th century ‚ù§Ô∏è
A lot of the master's originals! Free entry, mesmerizing art. Loved the visit.
Such an amazing exhibit! It is free and a quick visit! Highly recommend
It was very very bad, they dishonoured us, romanians, and they treat guests very, but very bad
one of my favorite art viewing experiences in paris.
A great place to see and to understand what is going through an artist's head.

I'm a Romanian and it is tied in to the story of art and culture. This exhibit is a display of ambition and a story of hard work, dedication and reimagining of what art is. You can sense how experimenting over time led to the results of today. It is a free exhibit and i recommend the experience if you really like modern art.
Reproduction of artists workshop with authentic work of arts. Free entry and the tour should take around one hour.

To be honest, I was expecting better. Especially given the fact that the Atelier he‚Äôs so famous, and located so closely to the Pompidou‚Ä¶ but nothing so amazing in my opinion. 4 stars nonetheless, as it is clear that Brancusi is such a famous artist.
We are from Romania and we went special for this museum to Paris. We are so grateful that ouer greatest sculptor let his heritage to the french state, with the condition that they will make a museum.
Amazing location! Great Romanian artist! Not to be missed while in Paris! Free entrance! Congrats France for hosting this amzing artist!
An oasis of peace and harmony in the middle of Paris, brough to you by the most beautiful Romanian soul! Just try it yourselves!

This is one of Pompidou, and represents Brancusi's studios. It's so well tidied up that it looks a bit far from where he actually worked, but you can see what kind of tools they worked with and what kind of work they did. It's free and it's not big. It may take 15 minutes to look around.
Replica of the workshop of this great sculptor
Interesting place, worth seeing.
Jaw dropping genius. Flexing, burning, exploding energy in stone and brass.
Small but worth a quick pass. Unless you are really into sculptures then you will probably enjoy it much more.
Beautiful space in Paris
Very well presented exhibition of the work of this fantastic artist. Though small very interesting and well worth a visit.
A beautiful replica of his former studio. All original pieces are arranged just as he curated it. A must see in Paris
